data.text:
Oklahoma City Thunder Tickets

Ride out the storm with Oklahoma City Thunder tickets. This NBA franchise has roots in Seattle starting in 1967. They were known as the Seattle SuperSonics and stayed until 2008. Then they moved to Oklahoma where they became the Oklahoma City Thunder. They play home games at the Chesapeake Energy Arena, which can be found at 100 W Reno Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73102. The OKC Thunder basketball team is a member of the Western Conference playing in the Northwest Division. They are currently the only professional sports team in the state of Oklahoma.

When they were the SuperSonics, they earned 22 NBA Playoff bids. They advanced to the NBA Finals three times, ultimately winning the 1979 NBA Championship. During their only national championship game, they defeated the Washington Wizards over five games.

Through the 2019 season, they have earned four conference titles and 11 division titles. Their last appearance in the NBA Finals came during the 2011-12 season but lost to the Miami Heat in five games.

The team’s mascot is Rumble the Bison. He can be seen wearing an OKC Thunder jersey. Notable players include Russell Westbrook, Kevin Durant, and Paul George. Secure your Oklahoma City Thunder tickets through TicketSmarter today.

Oklahoma City Thunder Ticket Prices

OKC Thunder ticket prices are based on who the OKC Thunder is playing as well as how far into the season the game is held. Basketball games earlier in the schedule typically offer cheaper tickets. Also, non-conference games tend to offer cheap OKC Thunder tickets. The Love’s Loud City section is the 300 level section at the Chesapeake Energy Arena. The arena has many different premium seating options available including the Champions Club and the terrace suites. To sort by Oklahoma City Thunder ticket prices, check out the interactive seating chart from TicketSmarter.

How much are Oklahoma City Thunder tickets?

Tickets for a home Oklahoma City Thunder basketball game start at $14 per seat. These tickets will be in the 300 level section of the Chesapeake Energy Arena. Most OKC Thunder tickets will average $79.

Oklahoma City Thunder Schedule

The Oklahoma City Thunder play their games as a part of the Western Conference's Northwest Division. Their most common opponents are fellow conference members such as the Denver Nuggets, Utah Jazz, Portland Trail Blazers and Minnesota Timberwolves. Typically the Oklahoma City Thunder schedule starts in October and can last through June if they earn a playoff berth. Oklahoma City Thunder Seating Chart

Originally known as the Ford Center from when it opened in 2002 through 2010. Then it became the Oklahoma City Arena for a year. It is now known as the Chesapeake Energy Arena. No matter the name, the Oklahoma City Thunder basketball team calls this venue their home. It has a seating capacity of 18,203. During the most recent renovation, the arena added numerous premium seats including suites and club seats. In total there are 3,380 club seats, seven party decks, and 49 suites. The Bunker Suites are courtside seats and bring you even closer to the action.

The north side of the Chesapeake Energy Arena you can find the Riverwind Casion Terrace Lounge. Sections 105, 106, 115, and 116 are center court seats. The team benches are in front of sections 114 through 117. The Love’s Loud City section is the 300 level seats surrounding the top of the venue.
